  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and leaking from one side. Package was placed into a haz bag and tote. Tote was taken to a QA area. DescribePack: 2 plastic bottles leaked from under plastic seals on caps. Package had room inside for contents to move around. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Contents were checked and adjustments made.

item.title: Report X-2024040764
item.description:
Report X-2024040764

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: DECATUR
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived in QA in a repacked Fedex box that was soaked and discolored. Package had no indication or labeling of hazmat status. Package had been previously DPR'd and poorly repacked at the destination station 62 and returned. It was loosely packed in the box and leaked a significant amount out by the time it arrived at 625. Seeing the package, I checked the SDS for hazmat status where it said it was regulated, UN3264. DescribePack: Cap was on and there is a plug underneath, but the plug appeared to not seal on one side of the hole and was leaking significantly out from under the cap. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately isolated upright in a lined Tote.

item.title: Report E-2024040377
item.description:
Report E-2024040377

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 8, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was damaged by surrounding freight and released approximately two (2) quarts of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the remediated site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. The damaged pail, all paint-impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040348
item.description:
Report E-2024040348

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES L
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 6, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of sodium hydroxide was crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel overpacked the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum, then deployed neutralizer to the release. The crew further remediated the site using absorbent pads. All sodium hydroxide-impacted materials were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024040518
item.description:
Report X-2024040518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package containing one plastic bottle of chlorine oxidizer. The box was on a pallet and was wet when it was found due to the bottle having a big tear/crack towards the bottom. The bottle spilled all of liquid out and is stained in a bag with small puddle of liquid. Box was found on bottom of pallet with another hazmat stacked on top. Could have been that the pressure of box on top somehow caused bottle to tear when loaded from the shipper. DescribePack: Box was wet on the bottom and stained with chlorine oxidizer. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a plastic bin with absorbent pads to contain spill.

item.title: Report X-2024040542
item.description:
Report X-2024040542

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Drum was placed on rollers. Drum fell over and rolled off the rollers. Dropped about 3 feet. Drum was placed upright in a lined tote before being sent to QA. Upon inspection, the top of the drum was dented, and liquid was leaking down the side. Drum was placed in a salvage drum ASAP. DescribePack: Upon inspection, the top of the drum was dented, and liquid was leaking down the side near where the dent was. There was also a small crack along one of the wall seams causing liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Drum was placed upright in a lined tote and sent to QA. QA placed in a lined salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024040652
item.description:
Report X-2024040652

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Large fully regulated hazmat package containing 4 4L glass bottles of methanol. The hazmat was being loaded to a trailer when the bottom of the box opened and one of the glass bottles fell out, completely breaking the bottle and spilling all of liquid. The bottom of the box looked to be glued but it loosened and caused to open when handling and moving box around. Other 3 hazmat glass bottles were undamaged. DescribePack: The box opened up from the bottom due to box possibly not having enough glue or glue not working properly. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat broken pieces were cleaned very carefully and all the liquid it spilled was cleaned with absorbent pads. The broken hazmat and the cleaning gear was placed inside a hazmat bag inside a plastic bin.

item.title: Report X-2024040449
item.description:
Report X-2024040449

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: NILES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was found leaking, upon inspection.it was found to be leaking PART B MEDIVAROTS RAPICIDE PA HIHG LEVEL DISIFECTANT FROM HAVING A LOOSE CAP, THE OTHER PRODUCT IDENTICAL TO THIS WAS WET BUT NOT DAMAGE OR LEAKING. AND THERE WAS A PACKAGE INSIDE AS WELL THAT WAS NAMED PART A EDIVAROTS RAPICIDE PA HIHG LEVEL DISIFECTANT WHICH ALSO LOOKED INTACT. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THIS PACKAGE WAS PUT IN A PLASTIC BAG AND TOTE AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT CAGE.
